content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 0 to node 7 in the given graph is:

1->3->7 The shortest path has five edges.

Please note that the graph edges represent direct connections between nodes, so if you move from one node to another, you must take the shortest possible route through the graph. The endpoint of the path should be the final node you reach. Here, we move from node 0 to node 3 (through edge 0->3), then to node 7 (through edge 3->7). Therefore, the shortest path from node 0 to node 7 is 1->3->7.

The shortest path from node 0 to node 3 in the given graph is:

0->3 The shortest path has two edges.

The shortest path in this case is the direct connection between node 0 and node 3, because there is only one way to get from node 0 to node 3 without passing through any other intermediate node. Please note that the graph edges represent direct connections between nodes, so if you move from one node to another, you must take the shortest possible route through the graph. Here, we move directly from node 0 to node 3. Therefore, the shortest path from node 0 to node 3 is 0->3.
